contentrichtext.text: '''XML Information Set''' ('''XML Infoset''') is a [[W3C recommendation|W3C specification]] describing an abstract data model of an [[XML]] document in terms of a set of ''information items''.<ref>[[#W3C XML Infoset|W3C XML Infoset]]</ref> The definitions in the XML Information Set specification are meant to be used in ''other'' specifications that need to refer to the information in a [[well-formed XML document]]. An XML document has an information set if it is [[Well-formed XML document|well-formed]] and satisfies the [[XML namespace|namespace]] constraints. There is no requirement for an XML document to be [[valid XML document|valid]] in order to have an information set. An information set can contain up to eleven different types of information items: #The Document Information Item (always present) #Element Information Items #Attribute Information Items #Processing Instruction Information Items #Unexpanded Entity Reference Information Items #Character Information Items #Comment Information Items #The Document Type Declaration Information Item #Unparsed Entity Information Items #Notation Information Items #Namespace Information Items Infoset recommendation Second Edition was adopted on February 4, 2004. ==Infoset Augmentation== Infoset augmentation or infoset modification refers to the process of modifying the infoset during [[XML schema|schema]] validation, for example by adding default attributes. The augmented infoset is called the post-schema-validation infoset, or [[PSVI]]. <ref>[http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-1/ XML Schema 1.1 Part 1: Structures]</ref> Infoset augmentation is somewhat controversial, with claims that it is a violation of modularity and tends to cause interoperability problems, since applications get different information depending on whether or not validation has been performed. <ref>[http://www.imc.org/ietf-xml-use/mail-archive/msg00217.html ''RELAX NG and W3C XML Schema''], [[James Clark (XML expert)|James Clark]], 4 Jun 2002</ref> Infoset augmentation is supported by [[XML Schema (W3C)|XML Schema]] but not [[RELAX NG]]. ==Serialization== Typically, XML Information Set is serialized as XML. Currently, there are also readers for CSV-based XML-Infosets<ref>[http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa302293.aspx XmlCsvReader Implementation]</ref> or JSON.<ref>[http://cxf.apache.org/docs/json-support.html Apache CXF JSON Support]</ref> ==See also== XML Information Set instances: * [[Document Object Model]] * [[Xpath data model]] * [[SXML]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{cite web | url=http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-infoset/ | publisher=W3C | title=XML Information set recommendation (Second Edition) | date=4 February 2004 | ref=W3C XML Infoset }} * [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/articles/javase/fastinfoset-139262.html Fast Infoset] (for binary encoding of the Infoset) {{W3C Standards}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xml Information Set}} [[Category:World Wide Web Consortium standards]] [[Category:XML-based standards]] {{compu-network-stub}} [[ja:Extensible Markup Language#XMLインフォメーションセット]]
